TEXT: The applicant was born in DATE and lives in PERSON . He is represented before the Court by PERSON , a lawyer practising in PERSON . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) are represented by their Agent , PERSON , of ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
The applicant worked as a printer from DATE until DATE , when he had to report sick , having suffered from headaches , nose bleedings , dizziness and fatigue for some time .

On DATE his doctor reported to ORG , formerly called GPE ) that the applicant ’s illness could be a work related injury resulting from organic - solvents poisoning , and thus giving rise to compensation .

On DATE , ORG informed the applicant that it was unable to make its assessment within DATE time - limit set out in GPE against the consequences of Industrial Injuries ( lov om forsikring mod følger af arbejdskade ) , the reason being that the disease did not meet the conditions for recognition according to the list of occupational diseases pursuant to the said LAW . Therefore the case had to be submitted to ORG ) before a decision could be taken .

On DATE ORG recommended dismissal of the case as the disease was not exclusively or predominantly due to the applicant ’s work . By decision of DATE the ORG refused to acknowledge that the applicant ’s illness was an occupational disease within the meaning of ORG against the consequences of Industrial Injuries .
On DATE , the applicant appealed against the decision to ORG ( PERSON ) , which on DATE upheld the decision .

Twice , enclosing new medical assessments , the applicant requested in vain that the case be reopened . His requests were refused by ORG on DATE and CARDINAL DATE and , on appeal , by ORG on respectively CARDINAL DATE and DATE , with the reasoning that the result of the new medical examinations confirmed the previous ones .

On DATE , anew the applicant requested a reopening of his case , which resulted in ORG initiating a neurological examination of the applicant . On DATE ORG , on the basis of the neurological medical certificate , re - opened the case and , by decision of CARDINAL DATE , it recognised that the applicant ’s injury was work related .
Thereafter , on DATE ORG found that the applicant ’s degree of disablement amounted to PERCENT .
On DATE it found that the degree of his loss of working capacity amounted to PERCENT .
On appeal , on DATE ORG upheld the calculation as to the degree of disablement and on DATE as to the degree of the loss of working capacity .

On DATE , the applicant applied for free legal aid with GPE ( PERSON ) with a view to initiating civil proceedings before the courts against ORG claiming that his loss of working capacity amounted to PERCENT , In this connection the latter heard ORG , which on DATE decided to re - open the case and re - calculate the applicant ’s degree of loss of working capacity to PERCENT .

CARDINAL . On DATE , having been granted free legal aid , the applicant instituted civil proceedings before ORG of Eastern GPE ( PERSON ) claiming that the degree of his loss of working capacity be set to PERCENT . By judgment of DATE the High Court found for ORG . On appeal , on DATE , ORG ( Højesteret ) upheld the judgment .

CARDINAL . NORP In the meantime , on DATE ORG refused to re - open the case concerning its assessment of the applicant ’s degree of disablement . Consequently , on DATE the applicant instituted another set of proceedings before the High Court claiming that ORG should acknowledge that his degree of disablement be set to PERCENT , or in the alternative PERCENT . ORG stated that in accordance with the new scale ( méntabel ) to be used as from DATE , it could accept that the degree be set to PERCENT . By judgment of DATE the High Court found that the degree of disablement should be set to PERCENT .
The applicant appealed against the judgment to ORG . Having obtained another medical expert statement on DATE , by judgment of DATE , ORG upheld the High Court judgment of DATE .
According to NORP law it is not a requirement for instituting civil court proceedings that administrative appeal proceedings have been exhausted beforehand , unless specifically provided .
The relevant provisions of the then applicable Act on Protection against LAW PERSON om forsikring mod følger af arbejdskade , nu afløst af PERSON om arbejdsskadesikring ) , were worded as follows :
Where nothing to the contrary has been provided , ORG Injuries shall make decisions on all matters under LAW .
CARDINAL . Decisions made by ORG under section DATE may be brought before ORG by
a ) the injured person or the injured person ’s surviving relatives ; [ and ] ...

A ORG judgment printed in ORG ( ORG ) , DATE , page CARDINAL , concerned a nurse who injured her back during work . Having acknowledged that her injury was work related , ORG fixed her degree of disablement at PERCENT and her loss of working capacity at PERCENT . Without pursuing any further administrative appeals , the nurse brought the decision concerning the degree of loss of working capacity directly before ORG , which passed judgment remitting the case to ORG on the ground that the latter had not taken the nurse ’s income into account when making its decision . The nurse appealed against ORG judgment to ORG , which by judgment of DATE fixed her loss of working capacity at PERCENT .

Pursuant to section CARDINAL of ORG ( Retsplejeloven ) , as the main rule , civil proceedings are instituted before ORG being the first judicial instance . Certain lawsuits , however , are brought before ORG ( sections CARDINAL and CARDINAL of the said Act ) as the court of first instance , for example if a dispute between an individual and the public concerns a review of a decision taken by the administrative body , which has the highest authority , like ORG .
